result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian A. Kloske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No alcohol or illegal drug use.
------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-----------------------------

Complete Thinking for Change (CBT)
-----------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-----------------------------
The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-----------------------------

Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------

Pay restitution in the amount of $59.51 and restitution surcharge.
------------------------------

June 27, 2016 at 8:00 a.m.

9:47 a.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Andrew R Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Christian A. Kloske in court with Atty Aneeq Ahmad.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing on Case 2015CF000070.  
Atty Ahmad has reviewed the PSI with his client and he does not have any corrections.  
9:48 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Herrmann.  State is asking Court to adopt sentencing recommendations of the PSI.  
9:56 am  Argument as to sentence by Attorney Ahmad.  
10:08 am  Statement by the Defendant.  
10:09 am  Further argument by Atty Herrmann.  
10:09 am  Court will take a break to consider this matter and will return at 10:25 with its decision.  
10:25 am  Court in session.  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the Defendant
10:26 am  Atty Herrmann makes a record with regard to victim notification.  
Court reads PSI writers impressions as set forth in the PSI into the record.  
Discussion between Court and Attorneys with regard to restitution.  Attorney Herrmann believes the victim was reimbursed for restitution by the Crime Victim Compensation Board in the amount of $59.51.  Court will hold restitution "open" at this time.  Attorney Herrmann to look into this further and advise the Court what if any restitution is owed and to whom it is owned.  

WITHHELD SENTENCE - on all counts - Three (3) years probation -

1)  On Count #1 - Sixty (60) days in Jail WITHOUT work release to commence on or before June 27, 2016  
2)  AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations  
3)  Restitution is held open for thirty (30) days; Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.   
4)  Maintain full time employment  
5)  No alcohol or illegal drug use  
6)  Complete Thinking for Change (CBT)  
7)  DNA sample and surcharges

Court makes record that it is NOT granting Special Disposition.   

NOTE:  
File 2015CF000424 remains on for FPT on 6/2/16 at 2:30 pm and JT on 06/07/2016 at 8:30 am
Files 2015CM000319 and 2015CT000301 shall track file 2015CF000424.  

10:34 am  Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.

8:47 am  Atty Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Christian A. Kloske in court with Atty Aneeq Ahmad.  
Also present in Court is Atty Haley Johnson.  
Matter is on the calendar today for a Court Trial.  
Atty Ahmad indicates that Mr. Kloske wishes to plead to the charges.  
Atty Herrmann confirms there is no plea agreement.  
Court has plea colloquy with Mr. Kloske.  
Deft enters GUILTY plea to Count #1, #2 and #3 of the Information.  
Court finds Deft's plea to be entered voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently.  
Court adjudges the Defendant guilty.  
State requests a PSI be ordered. 
PSI Ordered by Court.  
State also asks the Court to order the Deft to pay the Officer's overtime.  
Argument by Attorney Ahmad.  
Court orders that Mr. Kloske pay the $85.00 to the Clerk of Courts office within two (2) weeks.  
Court notes deft has a number of files that are open and tracking this case.  

Court reschedules court dates on case 2015CF000424 as follows:  
Final pre-trial on June 2, 2016 at 2:30 pm  
Jury Trial on June 6 and 7, 2016 at 8:30 am  

The BFH on file 2015CF000249 shall track to April 29 at 3:30 pm

The deft's open CM, CT & TR files shall track to April 29th at 3:30 pm
(2015CM000319, 2015CT000301 and 2015TR005064)
Waiver of Trial by Jury

4:42 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also present is ADA Haley Johnson.  
Defendant Christian A. Kloske in court with attorney Aneeq Ahmad.    
Matter was put on the calendar because the defendant is wishing to waive his right to a jury trial.  
Court has colloquy with Mr. Kloske concerning his waiver of the Jury Trial. 
Court finds waiver to be done knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.  
Matter will proceed to Court Trial on Monday at 8:30 am  
4:44 p.m.  Court in recess.  Court trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR.  
Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christian A. Kloske in court with attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  
Matter is on the calendar for Final pre-trial.  This case is schedule for JT on Monday.
The parties do not have an agreement.  
Attorney Herrmann makes a record as to the offers that were made by the State to Mr. Kloske.
Those offers were not accepted by the Defendant and are being withdrawn by the State at this time.  
Discussion between Court and Attys concerning any pre-trial matters.  
Any Motions in Limine are to be filed by noon on Friday.
State is to filed Jury Instructions by noon on Friday.  
Case is confirmed for trial.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

TOTAL BOND COVERS FILES 15GF959, 15CT301, 15CF70, 15CF249, 15CM319
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): MUST POST $1,000 CASH.

Defendant Christian A. Kloske in court, in custody with attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Atty Ahmad granted. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christian A. Kloske in court with attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Diane Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is scheduled for Jury Trial on Monday, October 26th, on Case 2015CF000249.  Attorney Ahmad has filed a Motion for Continuance of the Trial in that case.  Files 2015CF000070 and 2015CM000319 are tracking and were scheduled for a status conference today at 1:15 p.m.  Court advises Attorneys that it has reviewed the e-mails of both Attorney Ahmad and Attorney Donohoo with regard to the Motion to Continue the Trial.  Response by Attorney Ahmad to Court's question as to the defense witness that was just added to the defense witness list.  Response by Attorney Donohoo with regard to the pending criminal charges of that witness.  Court makes record and denies Motion.  Case 2015CF000249 remains on for Jury Trial on Monday.  State makes record as to offers that were made to the Defendant.  Defendant acknowledges that he has not accepted the State's offer.  State withdraws the offer.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Defendant Christian A. Kloske in court with attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case (2015CF000070) is before the Court date for a status conference.  
Defendant has another case, 2015CF000249 which was scheduled for a final pre-trial today.
File 2015CF000249 has not been resolved and is schedule for Jury trial on Monday as a "back up" to another matter being tried before this Court on Monday.
Attorney Ahmad is the Defense Attorney on both cases currently scheduled for trial.
If the other case is resolved, then Mr. Kloske's case (2015CF000249) will be tried on Monday.
Court is setting this for a status conference on Friday at 1:15 p.m.
STATUS CONFERENCE:  Friday, October 23, 2015 at 1:15 p.m.  
Judge Reddy will not be here on Friday so this will be heard by Judge Koss.
Status conference at 10-21-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Christian A. Kloske in court with attorney Stephen Kramer appearing on behalf of Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Attorney Ahmad is currently in trial before Judge Carlson.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kramer advises the Court that the parties hope to reach a global resolution on all matters.  The Defendant has a Final pre-trial  set for October 21, 2015 at 2:30 p.m. in Case 2015CF000249.  Attorney Kramer asks that the Monday jury trial in file 2015CF000070 be canceled at this time and continued to October 21st at 2:30 p.m.  File 2015CM000319 would also track to this same date.  Court cancels Monday's trial.  This case (2015CF000070) would have been bumped from the trial calendar by another case going to trial on Monday in any event.  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
